description:
'Thor: Love and Thunder' is an upcoming American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics character Thor. It is produced by Marvel Studios, directed by Taika Waititi, and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures. It is intended to be the direct sequel to Thor: Ragnarok (2017), and will be the 29th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). The film is scheduled to premiere in Los Angeles on June 23, 2022, and will be released in the United States on July 8, 2022.

This is a market on how much 'Thor: Love and Thunder' will gross domestically on its opening weekend. The “Domestic Weekend” tab on https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt10648342/ will be used to resolve this market once the values for the opening weekend (July 8-10) are final (i.e. not studio estimates).

This market will resolve to "Yes" if 'Thor: Love and Thunder' grosses more than $145,000,000 on the opening weekend. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Opening weekend is defined as the first Friday, Saturday, and Sunday of the film's release. Please note, this market will resolve according to the Box Office Mojo number under Domestic Weekend for the 3-day weekend, regardless of whether domestic refers to only the USA or to the USA and Canada, etc.

If there is no final data available by July 15, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET, another credible resolution source will be chosen.

events.description: 'Thor: Love and Thunder' is an upcoming American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics character Thor. It is produced by Marvel Studios, directed by Taika Waititi, and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures. It is intended to be the direct sequel to Thor: Ragnarok (2017) and the 29th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) as part of Phase Four of the MCU. The film is scheduled to premiere in Los Angeles on June 23, 2022, and released in the United States on July 8, 2022.
events.title: Thor: Love and Thunder

groupItemTitle: More than $145 million gross on opening weekend?
question: Will ‘Thor: Love and Thunder’ gross more than $145 million domestically on its opening weekend?
